messages.message: HI team, is anyone using https://github.com/instabase/instabase-sdk-py. Id like to reuse it for the sdk i wrote for instabase classic and aihub apis
pretty sure this was a proof of concept that Mohit worked on for a short bit. CC: @Ashish on if you can take this over

Thanks, Andy!

@joshbronko purpose of this is to be a publicly available SDK for Instabase (similar to boto3 for AWS). It will be best to partner with other engineering managers on making changes to this SDK as this can be used as a one-stop shop for managing communication with Instabase via APIs

You can read more about this SDK here - https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SAAS/pages/1784315936/Instabase+SDK+for+Python

There is also a go version of this SDK: https://github.com/instabase/instabase-sdk-go which we should try to keep in sync with python.

cc @Heymian @shaunak and @Kerry for visibility
Okay, ill create a separate repo then
would your sdk be publicly accessible? I'm curious to know about the outcome you are looking for with the sdk you have in mind!
Yes, i think it should be publicly available as it handles our public apis but i think we should figure out the best stream moving forward to standardize it without limiting the progression of it

if you are planning to have a publicly accessible SDK, then I encourage you to use the existing SDK and partner with an engineering manager (@Heymian, maybe you can help?)

by having two publicly accessible sdks can/will create confusion for our end users
It may be good for me to setup some time with the right folks to see how we progress this forward.
